EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of two stone furnaces positioned at (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0), each paired with dedicated burner‑inserters and wooden chests that regulate the input and output of smelting operations.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of a burner‑mining drill located at (–15.0, –50.0) linked to a nearby wooden chest at (–13.5, –51.5). This setup is integrated into a transport‑belt network that distributes the mined ore.

### Steam Power Generation System
Centered on a boiler at (8.0, 20.5) (currently out of fuel) with connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5). A series of steam engines are placed at:
• (0.5, 9.5)  
• (18.5, 11.5)  
• (1.5, 13.5)  
• (13.5, 14.5)  
• (19.5, 14.5)  
• (22.5, 18.5)  
• (17.5, 20.5)  
• (12.5, 21.5)  
• (4.5, 23.5)  
Additionally, an extra steam engine remains unplaced due to severe congestion in the boiler area and obstruction in the buildable zone near (8.5, 22.5); diagnostic reports from multiple steps confirm that this placement issue persists.

### Automation Research Lab
Features a lab configured for automation science pack research; however, it continues to experience unstable power connectivity.

### Electrical and Transport Infrastructure
Comprises an integrated network of electrical poles organized into electricity groups, multiple belt groups for managing transport belts, and pipe groups that bundle fluid pipes—ensuring coordinated flow of power, materials, and fluids.

### Offshore Pump and Fluid Network
Consists of an offshore pump at (0.5, 30.5) that feeds water into the fluid system through a connected network of pipes.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Persistent Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue  
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable due to severe congestion around the boiler area (8.0, 20.5) and an obstructed buildable region near (8.5, 22.5), with overlapping and misaligned burner‑inserters and transport belts.  
  – Tip: Conduct a thorough manual inspection of the boiler and its surrounding connection interfaces. Remove, reposition, or adjust interfering entities and consider relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area or modifying the boiler layout to create sufficient clearance.

• Burner Fuel Supply Shortages  
  – Multiple burner‑inserter and mining drill entities are frequently reported as “out of fuel” or “waiting for source items.”  
  – Tip: Ensure proper placement of fuel sources adjacent to these burner‑powered entities and maintain a continuous supply to prevent operational stalls.

• Steam Engine Connectivity and Fluid Input Issues  
  – Several steam engines display warnings such as “not connected to power network” and “no input liquid” or “no fluid present in connections.”  
  – Tip: Verify and reconfigure electrical cabling and fluid piping networks to ensure all steam engines are adequately connected and receive necessary inputs.

• Laboratory Power Deficiency  
  – The automation lab consistently experiences unstable power connectivity.  
  – Tip: Reassess the placement and wiring of nearby electrical poles to provide a more reliable power supply to the lab.

• General Layout Congestion  
  – The cluttered boiler region and overlapping transport structures impede the placement of additional entities.  
  – Tip: Reevaluate the overall spatial layout to reduce overlaps and clear obstructed zones, thereby allowing proper placement of structures and smoother interconnections.
